item.title: Senior Expert in Agricultural Finance
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to the ACP Secretariat in the framework of the Commodities Programme - Agricultural Financing Expert

DAI will provide the ACP Secretariat with the appropriate expertise to facilitate the implementation and monitoring of the strategies linked to the agricultural commodities, and the follow-up of the Commodities Programme.

The Consultant will provide expertise to the ACP Secretariat and the Regions concerned on issues pertaining to technical, operational and institutional areas related to the implementation of the ACP Agricultural Commodities Strategy and the follow-up of the Commodities programme; or on other specific issues and sectors deemed of importance by the ACP Secretariat, providing specific expertise and potentially creating/ consolidating links between commodities initiatives and financial institutions. Through its specific role in support of the ACP Secretariat, the Consultant will have finally an important role in identifying priority areas for potential future interventions. The Consultant will support public and private sectorial organisations, and notably financial institutions, to engage in a process of dialogue in agricultural commodities sector, including Development Financial institutions, (DFIs), Regional Economic Communities (RECs) and Commodities Boards such as ICCO for cocoa for example.

Location: The Consultant will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The activities of the project will be carried out principally in the ACP/EU region.

Expert in Agricultural Finance (260 working days)

Qualifications and skills:

A university degree in economics, agricultural-economics, finance or a comparable qualification, or equivalent experience. Ability to work both in English and French; excellent drafting and data analysis skills.

General professional experience:

  • Minimum of twelve (12) years of professional experience with agricultural organisations,agricultural sector institutions, capacity building and support to farmer groups;
  • Minimum of ten (10) years of professional experience related with Development FinancialInstitutions.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least five (5) years' experience dealing with commodities sector and notably cocoa, coconut and/or roots/ tubers operational and thematic sectoral issues,
  • At least five (5) years' experience related to the design/ implementation/ monitoring of specific financial schemes (promoting leverage effects) for value chain programmes;
  • At least five (5) years' experience related to ACP development cooperation programmes.

The Policy and Monitoring expert will have to perform the following priority tasks:

  • Provide the ACP Secretariat with information related to various areas or issues of concerns, as requested by them;
  • Design of the operational and technical procedures to be put in place;
  • Liaison with various stakeholders;
  • Design and validation of the monitoring and evaluation system to be put in place,implementation of the monitoring system for the programme with objectively verifiable indicators (OVI); in the context of this monitoring solicit corresponding actors to obtain regular information on the activities carried out;
  • Preparation of the annual update;
  • Preparation of the reports to be prepared by the TA (see point 7);
  • Preparation of value chain sectorial information based on financial aspects, as required, on cocoa, roots/ tubers and coconut and other commodities of importance (see point 4);
  • Preparation of inputs to the Website for the programme and ensure interaction with users on the information presented (in French and English), and sharing of information with the Value Chain experts;
  • Preparation and supervision of regular information letters, information working papers and documents for workshops or any other event;
  • Liaison with programme stakeholders, and in particular partner IOs, for the retrieval and dissemination of programme related information;
  • If deemed necessary, participation in press conferences;
  • Identify, design and coordinate linkages mechanisms between programme initiatives and financial institutions;
  • Identify and feed the database of contact details of cotton sector stakeholders;
  • Any other work as deemed necessary.

item.title: Administrative Assistant
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Security Project, Jordan

The main objectives of the evaluation are to provide the relevant external co-operation services of the European Union and the partner government with an overall independent assessment of the current and past performance of the EU-Funded programmes in the fields of security and safety, paying particularly attention to the results of the following projects against their designed objectives and the security objectives of the EU more particular in the fields of CVE and CT. It should have a strategical rather than operational focus.

The mid-term evaluation for Decision IcSP 2015/038-522 will mainly aim to:

  • draw lessons from the first months/years of the intervention implementation;
  • adjust the contents of the on-going intervention in relation to realities in the field and/or contextual developments;
  • improve the intervention under way and its results;
  • identify other areas of support after the end of the programme.

While for the final evaluation for Decision ENPI 2012/023-533 and all remaining projects the main aim will be to :

  • detect the real changes in the field and analyse the changes produced by the intervention;
  • check and explain achieved results;
  • identify and judge unexpected results;
  • assess the sustainability of the intervention’s benefits;
  • report to the institutions that have allocated the resources;
  • transfer acquired experiences to other countries or sectors.

The evaluation should cover all evaluation criteria (relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, impact, sustainability + EU value added and coherence).

Administrative Assistant

The Administrative assistant shall have proven organizational, logistic and administrative experiences in Jordan. Arabic mother tongue and a very good level of written and spoken English are essential. Interpretation skills from and into Arabic will be considered as an advantage.
